en.li_1: Obtain two cells to pass this stage.
en.li_2: Obtain four cells to pass this stage.
en.li_3: Obtain six cells to pass this stage.
en.stagewin: Excellent job! Keep the life growing!
en.levelwin_1: Magnificent! You are a bacteria expert!
en.levelwin_2: Nice job! You are an expert on plant cells!
en.levelwin_3: Well done! You are a expert on animal cells!
en.gamewin: Superb! Now you know a lot more about cells. Congratulations!
en.stagelose: Oh, no! It's not easy to get by in this tiny world.
en.levelsaveopt_1: Those mean viruses. But don't worry!
en.levelsaveopt_2: Maybe, if you can answer this question you can get back to keeping those cells growing!
en.correct_save: That's correct! I wouldn't expect less from you.
en.incorrect_save: Oh my, I guess that you should restart the level.
en.ct_1_1: Hello there! Welcome to my laboratory.
en.ct_1_2: Cells are tiny. They are so tiny that we need a MICROSCOPE to be able to see them.
en.ct_1_3: The CELL is the most basic unit that can be classified as a LIVING THING.
en.ct_1_4: All organisms contain at least one CELL.
en.ct_1_5: Organisms with only one cell are called UNICELLULAR organisms.
en.ct_1_6: When a cell does not have a defined nucleus, it is called a PROKARYOTE.
en.ct_1_7: Bacteria and Archaea are UNICELLULAR and PROKARYOTES.
en.tt_1_1: Click on a CELL to select it and view its ATP bar.
en.tt_1_2: Swipe and hold on the screen to move the cell or use arror or WASD keys.
en.tt_1_3: Pass next to smaller molecules to absorb them.
en.tt_1_4: These are PROTEINS, you need them to grow up and reproduce.
en.tt_1_5: Click on a fully grown cell to divide it by MITOSIS.
en.tt_1_6: That molecule is a GLUCOSE. Pass by it to break it and recharge your cells ATP energy bar.
en.tt_1_7: OXYGEN is needed but bacteria can do without it using FERMENTATION.
en.tt_1_8: Click repeatedly on cell to excrete an absorbed virus before is too late!
en.tt_1_9: Great! Now you're ready to take your bacteria to this wild tiny world!
en.ct_2_1: Animals and plants are MULTICELLULAR organisms. They have MILLONS of cells!
en.ct_2_2: EUKARYOTIC cells have a nucleus where the DNA is located.
en.ct_2_3: These cells are found in Animals, Plants, Fungi and some Protists.
en.ct_2_4: EUKARYOTIC cells also have ORGANELLES inside them.
en.ct_2_5: These ORGANELLES help the CELL to perform the basic functions of life:
en.tt_2_1: See right there, it's a GLUCOSE. Please, pick it!
en.tt_2_2: To break that GLUCOSE, you'll need to absorb OXYGEN particles first.
en.tt_2_3: Good job! Now you have gathered both GLUCOSE and OXYGEN.
en.tt_2_4: Lastly, you'll need to put your cells under a beam of light. This process is called PHOTOSYNTHESIS.
en.tt_2_5: Perfect! Now, let's see how can you do it in this wild tiny world!
en.ct_3_1: Humans have about 200 different types of specialized cells that make up the different tissues, organs, and systems in our body.
en.s_q_b_1_1: What do we need to be able to see a cell?
en.s_q_b_2_1: What is the basic unit that can be classified as a living thing?
en.s_q_p_1_1: When a cell does not have a defined nucleus what is it called?
en.s_q_a_1_1: What do eukaryotic cells have inside?
en.s_q_a_2_1: Esta es otras pregunta de salvataje para el stage de animal
en.warn_pick_glucose-o-l: Oxygen and sunlight are necessary too.
